remarks: The "tube lemma".  If ` X ` is compact and there is an open set ` U ` containing the line ` X X. { A } ` , then there is a "tube" ` X X. u ` for some neighborhood ` u ` of ` A ` which is entirely contained within ` U ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
statement:
txtube.x $e |- X = U. R $.
txtube.y $e |- Y = U. S $.
txtube.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Comp ) $.
txtube.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. Top ) $.
txtube.w $e |- ( ph -> U e. ( R tX S ) ) $.
txtube.u $e |- ( ph -> ( X X. { A } ) C_ U ) $.
txtube.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Y ) $.
txtube $p |- ( ph -> E. u e. S ( A e. u /\ ( X X. u ) C_ U ) ) $.
$d A u $.
$d R u $.
$d S u $.
$d U u $.
$d X u $.
$d Y u $.
$d ph u $.
